bodycopy-description: The main article or text part (as distinct from the headings, subheadings, and graphics)
clarification-description: specify or explain an existing fact or meaning by example or discussion without adding new information.
cleanuptag-description: A template that notes of an issue in the page. E.g. "reads like an advert", {{citation needed}}, or "COI involved"
copyediting-description: rephrase; improve grammar, spelling, tone, or punctuation.
datavalue-description: Numbers, True/False/yes/no, dates or time. E.g. January 3rd, $150, 2015/01/02, {{Infobox president|is-current=yes}}, etc.
disambiguation-description: re-link from a disambiguation page to the specific page.
elaboration-description: extend/add substantive new content; insert a fact or new meaningful assertion (beyond a simple Fact Update).
externallink-description: Links that use absolute URLs to point towards external domains. E.g. [https://wikimedia.org The Wikimedia Portal]
factupdate-description: update numbers, dates, scores, episodes, status, etc. based on newly available information.
information-description: Factual or meaningful information content.  Note that one could change "body copy" without changing the "information" contained.
interwikilink-description: Links to a page on another Wikimedia project website, such as Meta or another language. E.g. [[:mw:Extension:OAuth]]
markup-description: Elements used for formatting content (excludes tables, templates and special characters). E.g. ''' (bold), '' (italics) and HTML tags.
media-description: Media Files (Images, Audio, Video) objects. Usually in the form of a [[File:...]] link, but sometimes also appears in a template as a parameter filename = File:....
other-description: none of the above, please leave a note.
pov-description: rewrite using encyclopedic, neutral tone; remove bias; apply due weight.
process-description: start or continue a wiki process workflow such as tagging (or un-tagging) an article with cleanup, merge or deletion notices.
processtag-description: A template that implements an on wiki process. E.g. {{Prod}} or {{CSD}}.
punctuation-description: Body copy punctuation characters that are intended to appear in text. E.g. periods, commas, asterisks, brackets, colon, dash, etc.
ref-description: A reference tag and/or a citation template. E.g. <ref>{{cite book| ... }}</ref>
refactoring-description: restructure the article; move and rewrite content, without changing the meaning of it.
semanticlabels-label: Choose likely intention(s) for the edit
simplification-description: reduce the complexity or breadth of discussion; may remove information.
specialchars-description: Mathematical characters, greek characters, etc. E.g. Σ (&Sigma;) or · (&middot;)
table-description: Wikitext table code and/or the content contained within. E.g., {|, |, |-, |}
template-description: General template transclusions. E.g. {{Chemistry navbox}} or {{Infobox|...}} (not a citation template or cleanup template)
vandalism-description: deliberately attempt to damage the article.
wikification-description: make text more suitable for the wiki medium, e.g. adding links, or removing them where necessary; converting bold text to proper headers, etc; or manual of style related changes for formatting
wikilink-description: Links to another page within English Wikipedia. E.g. [[John_Smith_(professor)|Dr. Smith]]
